RelatedSentence: It was only hours after reports that San Antonio Mayor Julian Castro would  be picked by President Obama to act as the administration 's next Housing and Urban Development secretary that Castro 's next job was proposed : vice president of the United States in a Hillary Rodham Clinton administration .

Henry Cisneros , former HUD secretary ( and former San Antonio mayor ) , told Politico that Castro 's learning the breadth of the issues and the nation while serving in the Cabinet could land him a spot on a possible Hillary 2016 ticket .

Henry Cisneros , former HUD secretary ( and former San Antonio mayor ) , told Politico that Castro 's learning the breadth of the issues and the nation while serving in the Cabinet could land him a spot on a possible Hillary 2016 ticket .

Henry Cisneros , former HUD secretary ( and former San Antonio mayor ) , told Politico that Castro 's learning the breadth of the issues and the nation while serving in the Cabinet could land him a spot on a possible Hillary 2016 ticket .

But , Politico 's Edward - Isaac Dovere points out , HUD is not traditionally a very visible [ role ] - it 's not as if most Americans could name [ current HUD Secretary Shaun ] Donovan , or any of the past HUD secretaries .

You 'll notice two things about that list : First , good news for Hillary Clinton : Secretary of State is the most common launching pad ; second , Housing and Urban Development does not make an appearance .
It does , however , if you look at losing vice presidential candidates .
It does , however , if you look at losing vice presidential candidates .
Edmund Muskie , the Democratic pick for VP in 1972 , served as Secretary of State under Carter ( briefly ) .
Frank Knox , Republican VP candidate in 1936 , served as Secretary of the Navy ( when it was a Cabinet - level position ) .
Both of those candidates , incidentally , served in the Cabinet after they lost their races .
In 1996 , former secretary Jack Kemp joined Bob Dole 's ticket .
Philip Bump writes about politics for The Fix .
